Class Clock

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      Clock

public class Clock
extends greenfoot.Actor

Main class for the Clock object. Contains methods for displaying and setting the clock and switching between modes.

Version:
: 1.2
Author:
: Michael Wang and William Teeple

Method Detail

act

public void act()
Act - do whatever the Clock wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

calculateTime

public void calculateTime()
Updates the time of the clock appropriately, incrementing minutes/hours when necessary

Parameters:
: - (pre) Existing Clock object
: - (post) Increments the second variable every 1000 ms, and updates all other time variables as necessary

Increments or decrements the hour depending on the input argument

Parameters:
: - (pre) Existing Clock object
: - (post) Changes the clock hour, increments if argument is true, decrements if argument is false

Parameters:

public void is24Hour(boolean time)
Sets the clock to either 12- or 24 hour mode.

Parameters:
: - (pre) Existing Clock object
: - (post) Sets the clock to 24- hour mode if true, 12- hour mode if false
